prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to these specific spaces?
I like to browse reddit usually for communities for the games I play. Being a part of a community is an aspect of the game experience that I love!
What other topics, outside of gaming, do you enjoy reading or learning about online, and why do these topics interest you?
I am always keeping up with the news and with what people have to say.
Can you share some specific areas or topics within news and current events that you find most engaging, and how do you usually engage with these topics online?
Sure, when the titan submersible lost contact I was very involved in staying up-to-date with various news outlets, as well as seeing what others had to say on Twitter and Reddit about the incident.
What other hobbies or interests do you have that you haven't mentioned yet, and how do you engage with these interests online?
I actively look at discussions related to card games I play, which would be Pokemon and Yugioh. I use them to stay informed on current and upcoming products, events, etc.
What types of literature, music, or other forms of entertainment do you enjoy, and how do you engage with these interests online?
I don't really browse things related to books or music, but I love to browse stuff related to Marvel and seeing peoples theories on things that happened in the movies.

Can you tell me more about how you engage with the Marvel community online, such as the types of content you consume, discussions you participate in, or any other ways you interact with this interest?

Sure, I have been actively watching Secret Invasion as new episodes come out weekly and then seeing what people have to say online after the fact. It's interesting people drawing references to past things in the MCU.
Do you engage with any educational or learning platforms online, and if so, what subjects or skills are you interested in developing or learning more about?
Do you follow any specific influencers, bloggers, or content creators online related to your interests, and how do their perspectives or content enhance your engagement with these topics?
Yes there are a lot that I follow, mainly having to do with news such as Philip DeFranco, or my hobbies.

Can you share how you engage with the online communities related to the card games you play, such as the types of discussions you participate in, strategies you learn, or how you stay updated on new products and events?
Sure, I think it is very good to help learn new strategies to the new decks that come out.

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

feedback.feedback_other: no feedback but I did enjoy taking the study, thank you!

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
